00045 template <typename VALUE, typename KEYTYPE>
00046 struct CRangeMapHelper
00047 {
00049     typedef VALUE* ValuePtr;
00051     typedef VALUE& ValueRef;
00053     typedef const VALUE& ConstValueRef; 
00055     typedef const VALUE* ConstValuePtr;
00056 
00058     KEYTYPE first;
00060     VALUE  second;
00061 
00063     bool operator==(const CRangeMapHelper<VALUE, KEYTYPE>& o) const {
00064         return second == o.second;
00065     }
00066 };
00067

00072 template <typename KEYTYPE>
00073 struct CRangeMapHelper<void, KEYTYPE>
00074 {   
00075     typedef void ValuePtr;
00076     typedef void ValueRef;
00077     typedef void ConstValueRef;
00078     typedef void ConstValuePtr;
00079     
00080     KEYTYPE first;
00081 
00082     bool operator==(const CRangeMapHelper<void, KEYTYPE>&) const {
00083         return true;
00084     }
00085 };

00114 template <typename VALUE, typename KEYTYPE = uint64>
00115 class CRangeMap
00116 {
00117     typedef CRangeMapHelper<VALUE, KEYTYPE> HELPER;
00118 private:
00120     typedef std::map<KEYTYPE, HELPER> RangeMap;
00122     typedef std::pair<KEYTYPE, HELPER> RangePair;
00123 
00125     typedef typename RangeMap::iterator RangeIterator;
00126     typedef typename RangeMap::const_iterator ConstRangeIterator;
00127     
00129     RangeMap    m_ranges;
00130 
00140     template <typename RealIterator, typename ReturnTypeRef, typename ReturnTypePtr>
00141     class iterator_base {
00142         friend class CRangeMap<VALUE, KEYTYPE>;
00143     public:
00144         iterator_base( const RealIterator& it )
00145             : m_it( it )
00146         {
00147         }
00148 
00150         bool operator==( const iterator_base& other ) const {
00151             return m_it == other.m_it;
00152         }
00153 
00155         bool operator!=( const iterator_base& other ) const {
00156             return m_it != other.m_it;
00157         }
00158 
00159         
00161         KEYTYPE keyStart() const {
00162             return m_it->first;
00163         }
00164         
00166         KEYTYPE keyEnd() const {
00167             return m_it->second.first;
00168         }
00169 
00170 
00172         iterator_base& operator++() {
00173             ++m_it;
00174             
00175             return *this;
00176         }
00177 
00179         iterator_base operator++(int) {
00180             return iterator_base( m_it++ );
00181         }
00182 
00183 
00185         iterator_base& operator--() {
00186             --m_it;
00187 
00188             return *this;
00189         }
00190 
00192         iterator_base operator--(int) {
00193             return iterator_base( m_it-- );
00194         }
00195 
00196 
00198         ReturnTypeRef operator*() const {
00199             return m_it->second.second;
00200         }
00201 
00203         ReturnTypePtr operator->() const {
00204             return &m_it->second.second;
00205         }
00206 
00207     protected:
00209         RealIterator m_it;
00210     };
00211 
00212     typedef typename HELPER::ValueRef ValueRef;
00213     typedef typename HELPER::ValuePtr ValuePtr;
00214     typedef typename HELPER::ConstValueRef ConstValueRef;
00215     typedef typename HELPER::ConstValuePtr ConstValuePtr;
00216 
00217 public:
00218     typedef iterator_base<RangeIterator, ValueRef, ValuePtr> iterator;
00219     typedef iterator_base<ConstRangeIterator, ConstValueRef, ConstValuePtr> const_iterator;
00220     
00222     typedef typename RangeMap::size_type size_type;
00223     
00225     typedef VALUE value_type;
00226     
00230     CRangeMap() {
00231     }
00232 
00236     CRangeMap(const CRangeMap<VALUE, KEYTYPE>& other)
00237         : m_ranges( other.m_ranges )
00238     {   
00239     }
00240 
00244     CRangeMap& operator=(const CRangeMap<VALUE, KEYTYPE>& other) {
00245         m_ranges = other.m_ranges;
00246 
00247         return *this;
00248     }
00249 
00253     void swap(CRangeMap<VALUE, KEYTYPE>& other) {
00254         std::swap(m_ranges, other.m_ranges);
00255     }
00256     
00257 
00263     bool operator==( const CRangeMap<VALUE, KEYTYPE>& other ) const {
00264         // Check if we are comparing with ourselves
00265         if ( this == &other ) {
00266             return true;
00267         }
00268         
00269         // Check size, must be the same
00270         if ( size() != other.size() ) {
00271             return false;
00272         }
00273         
00274         return (m_ranges == other.m_ranges);
00275     }
00276     
00277 
00281     iterator begin() {
00282         return m_ranges.begin();
00283     }
00284 
00288     iterator end() {
00289         return m_ranges.end();
00290     }
00291 
00295     const_iterator begin() const {
00296         return m_ranges.begin();
00297     }
00298 
00302     const_iterator end() const {
00303         return m_ranges.end();
00304     }
00305 
00306 
00315     iterator erase(iterator pos) {
00316         MULE_VALIDATE_PARAMS(pos != end(), wxT("Cannot erase 'end'"));
00317     
00318         RangeIterator temp = pos.m_it++;
00319 
00320         m_ranges.erase(temp);
00321 
00322         return pos;
00323     }
00324 
00325 
00329     size_type size() const {
00330         return m_ranges.size();
00331     }
00332 
00336     bool empty() const {
00337         return m_ranges.empty();
00338     }
00339 
00340 
00344     void clear() {
00345         m_ranges.clear();
00346     }
00347 
00348 
00358     // Find the range which contains key (it->first <= key <= it->second->first)
00359     iterator find_range( KEYTYPE key ) {
00360         if ( !m_ranges.empty() ) {
00361             // Find first range whose start comes after key
00362             // Thus: key < it->first, but (--it)->first <= key
00363             RangeIterator it = m_ranges.upper_bound( key );
00364 
00365             // Our target range must come before the one we found; does it exist?
00366             if ( it != m_ranges.begin() ) {
00367                 // Go back to the last range which starts at or before key
00368                 it--;
00369 
00370                 // Check if this range covers the key
00371                 if ( key <= it->second.first ) {
00372                     return it;
00373                 }
00374             }
00375         }
00376 
00377         return end();
00378     }
00379 
00380 
00381     void erase_range(KEYTYPE startPos, KEYTYPE endPos) {
00382         // Create default initialized entry, which ensures that all fields are initialized.
00383         HELPER entry = HELPER();
00384         // Need to set the 'end' field.
00385         entry.first = endPos;
00386         
00387         // Insert without merging, which forces the creation of an entry that 
00388         // only covers the specified range, which will crop existing ranges.
00389         erase(do_insert(startPos, entry, false));
00390     }   
00391     
00392 
00417     iterator insert(KEYTYPE startPos, KEYTYPE endPos) {
00418         HELPER entry = {endPos};
00419         return do_insert(startPos, entry);
00420     }
00421     template <typename TYPE>
00422     iterator insert(KEYTYPE startPos, KEYTYPE endPos, const TYPE& value) {
00423         HELPER entry = {endPos, value};
00424         return do_insert(startPos, entry);
00425     }
00427 
00428 protected:
00437     iterator do_insert(KEYTYPE start, HELPER entry, bool merge = true) {
00438         MULE_VALIDATE_PARAMS(start <= entry.first, wxT("Not a valid range."));
00439         
00440         RangeIterator it = get_insert_it(start);
00441         while ( it != m_ranges.end() ) {
00442             // Begins before the current span
00443             if ( start <= it->first ) {
00444                 // Never touches the current span, it follows that start < it->first
00445                 // (it->first) is used to avoid checking against (uintXX)-1 by accident
00446                 if ( entry.first < it->first - 1 && it->first ) {
00447                     break;
00448                 }
00449 
00450                 // Stops just before the current span, it follows that start < it->first
00451                 // (it->first) is used to avoid checking against (uintXX)-1 by accident
00452                 else if ( entry.first == it->first - 1 && it->first ) {
00453                     // If same type: Merge
00454                     if (merge && (entry == it->second)) {
00455                         entry.first = it->second.first;
00456                         m_ranges.erase( it++ );
00457                     }
00458 
00459                     break;
00460                 }
00461 
00462                 // Covers part of the span
00463                 else if ( entry.first < it->second.first ) {
00464                     // Same type, merge
00465                     if (merge && (entry == it->second)) {
00466                         entry.first = it->second.first;
00467                         m_ranges.erase( it++ );
00468                     } else {
00469                         // Resize the partially covered span and get the next one
00470                         it = ++resize( entry.first + 1, it->second.first, it );
00471                     }
00472 
00473                     break;
00474                 } else {
00475                     // It covers the entire span
00476                     m_ranges.erase( it++ );
00477                 }
00478             }
00479             
00480             // Starts inside the current span or after the current span
00481             else {
00482                 // Starts inside the current span
00483                 if ( start <= it->second.first ) {
00484                     // Ends inside the current span
00485                     if ( entry.first < it->second.first ) {
00486                         // Adding a span with same type inside a existing span is fruitless
00487                         if (merge && (entry == it->second)) {
00488                             return it;
00489                         }
00490 
00491                         // Insert the new span
00492                         m_ranges.insert(it, RangePair(entry.first + 1, it->second));
00493                         
00494                         // Resize the current span to fit before the new span
00495                         it->second.first = start - 1;
00496         
00497                         break;
00498                     } else {
00499                         // Ends past the current span, resize or merge
00500                         if (merge && (entry == it->second)) {
00501                             start = it->first;
00502                             m_ranges.erase( it++ );
00503                         } else {
00504                             // Resize the partially covered span and get the next one
00505                             it = ++resize( it->first, start - 1, it );
00506                         }
00507                     }
00508                 } else {
00509                     // Start past the current span
00510                     if ( start == it->second.first + 1 ) {
00511                         // Touches the current span
00512                         if (merge && (entry == it->second)) {
00513                             start = it->first;
00514                             m_ranges.erase( it++ );
00515                         } else {
00516                             ++it;
00517                         }
00518                     } else {
00519                         // Starts after the current span, nothing to do
00520                         ++it;
00521                     }
00522                 }
00523             }
00524         }
00525 
00526         return m_ranges.insert(it, RangePair(start, entry));
00527     }
00528 
00529     
00536     RangeIterator get_insert_it(KEYTYPE start)
00537     {
00538         if ( m_ranges.empty() ) {
00539             return m_ranges.end();
00540         }
00541 
00542         // The start-key of the last element must be smaller than our start-key
00543         // Otherwise there is the possibility that we can merge with the one before that
00544         RangeIterator it = --m_ranges.end();
00545         if ( start <= it->first ) {
00546             // If the two starts are equal, then we only need to go back another
00547             // step to see if the range prior to this one is mergeable
00548             if ( start != it->first ) {
00549                 it = m_ranges.lower_bound( start );
00550             }
00551 
00552             if ( it != m_ranges.begin() ) {
00553                 // Go back to the last range which starts at or before key
00554                 --it;
00555             }
00556         }
00557 
00558         return it;
00559     }
00560     
00561 
00563     RangeIterator resize( KEYTYPE startPos, KEYTYPE endPos, RangeIterator it ) {
00564         HELPER item = it->second;
00565         item.first = endPos;
00566 
00567         m_ranges.erase( it++ );
00568 
00569         return m_ranges.insert(it, RangePair(startPos, item));
00570     }
00571 };

00575 typedef CRangeMap<void> CRangeSet;

00578 namespace std
00579 {
00581     template <typename VALUE_TYPE, typename KEY_TYPE>
00582     void swap(CRangeMap<VALUE_TYPE, KEY_TYPE>& a, CRangeMap<VALUE_TYPE, KEY_TYPE>& b)
00583     {
00584         a.swap(b);
00585     }
00586 }
